bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to James D. Porter, February 10, 1887
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Receipt of Cable Despatch. Bond Forwarded.
Hon. Jas D. Porter Asst. Secretary of State Washington D.C.

Sir: I have the honor to inform you that your "Cable Despatch" sent to "Golee-Dakar" in order to reach me was received on the 7 of Feby 1887 after many days delay owing to the mail steamers which only stop at this port twice a month. I herewith inclose my

my bond, and would have sent it some time ago; but I thought it was not in my porver to do so unless a regular appointed Minister was present to certify, I hope no harm will result from my delay. Please intercede that I be detained during the two years administration of his excellency President Cleveland and I shall do my duty to the best of my ability. I hope my bond will meet your
I am, Sir, your obedient Servant
Samuel S. Sevier Acting U.S. Consul Gen.
Hon Jas D. Porter Assistant Secretary of State Washington D.C.
Bond on the way. Have me detained. Term out.
